Package it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match

Class CardGrid

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match.CardGrid
Direct Known Subclasses:
SingleCardGrid
public class CardGrid extends Object
A grid of DevelopmentCard decks

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CardGrid​(List<DevelopmentCard> cards)
    Builds the card grid starting from a list of DevelopmentCards sorted by CardType in this order: {[lv1, GREEN], [lv1, BLUE], [lv1, YELLOW], [lv1, PURPLE], [lv2, GREEN], [lv2, BLUE], ...etc.}

  • Constructor Details

    • CardGrid

      public CardGrid​(List<DevelopmentCard> cards) throws WrongSettingException
      Builds the card grid starting from a list of DevelopmentCards sorted by CardType in this order: {[lv1, GREEN], [lv1, BLUE], [lv1, YELLOW], [lv1, PURPLE], [lv2, GREEN], [lv2, BLUE], ...etc.} following the order of the color in the enumeration CardColor. You have to provide at least one card of any type. Requires that the list 'cards' have to be previously correctly sorted
      Parameters:
      cards - a sorted list of all the DevelopmentCards in the game
      Throws:
      WrongSettingException - if are given not enough CardTypes or in the wrong order
      See Also:
      CardType, DevelopmentCard

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public Stack<DevelopmentCard>[][] getGrid()
      Returns a shallow copy of the two-dimensional array of decks that form the grid, changes in Stack objects will be transferred into this. Use with caution
      Returns:
      a copy of the entire grid

    • countRemaining

      public CardType[] countRemaining()
      Counts the occurrences of each CardType in this
      Returns:
      an array of CardType where the value 'quantity' reports the occurrences of the own type in this
      See Also:
      CardType

    • isBuyable

      public boolean isBuyable​(Verificator verificator, int lv, int color) throws InvalidCardRequestException, NoMoreCardsException
      Returns True if the card in the given position is buyable by the player passed as verificator. The method controls if the player has the resources either in the warehouse or in the strongbox.
      Parameters:
      verificator - the player who wants to buy the card
      lv - the level of the card or the row of the grid in which it is placed (starting from 1)
      color - the int value for the color of the card (CardColor.getVal()) or the column of the grid in which it is placed (starting from 1)
      Returns:
      true if the card in the given position is buyable by the player passed as verificator
      Throws:
      InvalidCardRequestException - if it is tried to control a card out of range
      NoMoreCardsException - if it is tried to control a card from an empty stack

    • emptyColumnExists

      public boolean emptyColumnExists()
      Checks if there's an empty column This method is used in matchEndingProcedure (MatchController.class) to see if Lorenzo has won the match or not.
      Returns:
      true if an empty column exists, false elsewhere.

    • take

      public DevelopmentCard take​(int lv, int color) throws InvalidCardRequestException, NoMoreCardsException, LastRoundException
      draws the first DevelopmentCard from the deck in this grid in the given position (or with the given level and color). This method doesn't control if the player has already payed the resources to buy that card.
      Parameters:
      lv - the level of the card or the row of the grid in which it is placed (starting from 1)
      color - the int value for the color of the card (CardColor.getVal()) or the column of the grid in which it is placed (starting from 1)
      Returns:
      the drawn DevelopmentCard
      Throws:
      InvalidCardRequestException - if it is tried to draw a card out of range
      NoMoreCardsException - if it is tried to draw a card from an empty stack
      LastRoundException - never in multiplayer

    • getTop

      public DevelopmentCard[][] getTop()
      Returns:
      a matrix containing the first card of each stack of this in the right position

    • peek

      public DevelopmentCard peek​(int row, int col)
      Returns the first card of the deck in the given position without removing it
      Parameters:
      row - the number of row (starting from 1)
      col - the number of column (starting from 1)
      Returns:
      the first card of the deck in the given position
